text:
HI @channel

I have a use-case like,  When the page loads, I am fetching the data through a GET API call, and store in a variable. Now, in my variable, I have JSON data.  Now how could I process the JSON data in HUBL.? Like I need to loop in cards, and accordion components.

TIA

Hubl is a server side language so it's impossible for you to pass data you get from a GET request client side, you could maybe integrate the module with react/vue to display that data easily (and make sure that data you're trying to display is not important SEO wise, otherwise this approach is not the best)

<@U01QVR44MEY> Yeah at first it works fine! I set it as the highest priority as well, so it shows up first as the search results. It works fine at first, but after a few minutes, it just disappears overall? It's confusing.

Optima vt is the product page. I am directing the HubSpot url to the shopify one.
Second image is the settings. Any idea where I went wrong?

Both pages are published.
Honestly I have no idea why it would disappear, you might want to contact HubSpot support and see if they know why
Thanks, yeah they will email us back tomorrow hopefully. I thought I might have overlooked an option
Yeah it's definitely possible, but I don't see anything that you've missed
